- Smooth, rounded lines optimized for design

- Vector-based output for perfect scaling

- Trading platform designs

- Crypto website designs

- Price comparison visualizations

- Market analysis presentations

plugins.name: Themed
plugins.description:
Effortlessly switch between Light and Dark themes in Figma with just a single click! This plugin lets you leverage your design tokens using local or shared styles for seamless theme transitions.


Ensure you are following the same Name Token Convention. Ensure to create two folders called Light and Dark. Feel free to any subfolders you feel necessary ... just as long there is one for Light mode and Dark mode.


Example:

Light/Color100 -> Dark/Color100


How to use your Themed:

https://www.loom.com/share/bf36f3b1b3a44526bdd8b9a1e8a51e59



Using Local Styles:

In order use local styles be sure to setup local styles with the proper naming conventions.


Using Shared Styles:

Due to limitations in the Figma API we require you to provide an Access tokens and File Key.


Locating Figma Access tokens:

https://www.loom.com/share/89302449180d4de39748f6f8084fc5b1


Locating File Key:

https://www.loom.com/share/1a137ec463ee4510b0a79e5129e94e44



Once set up, enjoy one-click theme toggling and maintain design consistency across all your projects.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly switch between Light & Dark themes using your own design tokens

plugins.name: Create Icon Sets
plugins.description:
Create Icon Sets


It's dead simple.

select frames -> run the plugin -> save hours.


neatly organizes the component sets and sorts them alphabetically.


How it works:

frame names *must* include at least one / , \ or : and anything before is used to group the components.


arrow-right/filled

arrow-right/outline


arrow-left:filled

arrow-left:outline


arrow-left\filled

arrow-left\outline


gets combined into arrow-right component set with the property values "filled" and "outline"


Support & Feature Request

Find me on X -> @0xa3k5

Create a new issue on -> Github

plugins.name: AnnoDot
plugins.description:
AnnoDot is a flexible plugin that enhances your design workflow with dynamic, customizable annotations. The plugin allows designers to annotate their designs for better communication and clarity, with the flexibility to personalize their annotations for any project or need.


Each annotation can be edited post-creation within the plugin, ensuring information remains accurate and up-to-date. AnnoDot's refresh feature automatically updates annotation counts (at the push of a button) as designs evolve, eliminating confusion by maintaining unique identifiers for each note.


Key Highlights:


• Dynamic Annotation Creation: Easily create and edit annotations directly in your Figma designs for clear communication.


• Customizable Annotation Frames: Adjust frames to suit your project needs by choosing exactly what information to include in each annotation.


• Annotation Count Refresh: Keep your annotation numbers unique and updated as frames are added or removed, avoiding duplicates at the push of a button.


• Advanced Color Customization: Tailor the background and text colors of the annotation dot and its numbering for seamless design integration.


• Visual Tags: Use a default tag for development, bug, flow, or accessibility to quickly identify the tag or add personalized tags to your annotations, choosing your label, background, and text/border colors for distinct visibility.


• Enhanced Design Clarity: Improve your design workflow with informative and aesthetically pleasing annotations, which will enhance team communication and project understanding.


This was done as a passion project. I’m a designer who likes to dabble in coding. Please reach out with any issues you encounter, and I will do my best to update the plugin accordingly.
plugins.tagline: Annotate, Customize, Refresh: Design Clarity Made Easy

plugins.name: Pagefleet
plugins.description:
The Purpose

Pagefleet is built to help you save time by instantly generating all necessary pages for your design project instead of having to create them one by one. It comes equipped with three diverse templates that have been tailored to suit small, medium, and large design projects. Whether you're working on a website design, mobile app or a robust e-commerce site, Pagefleet has got you covered. To add to its versatility, it includes a custom feature that allows you reuse and edit any of the prebuilt templates to match your requirements.


How to use Pagefleet


Quickstart

Begin by running the plugin. Under the 'Quickstart' tab, you can select the project type that resonates with your requirements. Upon selection, a pre-defined set of pages are generated instantly, setting the stage for you to dive into your project.


Custom

If you wish to customize one of the templates, navigate to the 'Custom' tab and select the template you'd like to reuse. Once your template is selected, you have the freedom to modify the names of the pages by simply clicking on them. After you've made your desired changes, click on 'Generate Pages' to produce your own custom set of pages.


Limitations

  • If you are running the plugin on a fresh Figma file, it will rename the current page you're at with the first name in the template.
  • If you already have a few pages setup, running the plugin will rename only the current page and append the rest of the pages below it.

plugins.name: Numcraft
plugins.description:
Generate realistic data instantly for your design mockups and prototypes. From numbers, IDs to phone numbers, dates, and timestamps - populate your designs with data in just a few clicks.


Features:

* Generate sequential or random numbers in any format

* Generate sequential or random IDs in any format

* Create realistic phone numbers for any region

* Insert dates in multiple formats (MM/DD/YYYY, DD-MM-YY, etc.)

* Add timestamps and time strings for scheduling interfaces

* Batch generate data across multiple layers

* Customize formats to match your project needs


Stop using placeholder text like "123" or "XX-XX-XXXX". Make your designs feel authentic with real-looking data that matches production environments.


Perfect for:

* Any design that needs realistic data structure

* Amounts

* User profiles and contact lists

* Transaction histories

* Event schedules and calendars

* Order tracking interfaces


Save time and bring your mockups closer to the final product with just one click.
plugins.tagline: Generate numbers for your projects easily

plugins.name: Lingohub for Figma
plugins.description:
Localize all your Figma projects with Lingohub — all your texts, in one place!


With Lingohub, you can seamlessly localize any project, from web or mobile apps to games or websites. Our continuous translation management and streamlined workflows integrate effortlessly into your development process.


How it works with our Figma plugin

•Push text segments from Figma directly to Lingohub.

•Pull completed translations back into Figma and instantly preview your localized designs.

•Context is key: screenshots of your designs are automatically uploaded to Lingohub, eliminating the need to add them manually.


What you can do with Lingohub

•Collaborate with multiple teams on localization.

•Automate your software localization tasks.

•Translate with our powerful, feature-rich editor (term base, translation memory, quality checks, and more).


For more details on using the Figma plugin, see our Help Center article.


A paid Lingohub account is required to use the Figma plugin. We offer a 14-day free trial so you can experience all features. Need help? Contact our support or schedule a free demo.
plugins.tagline: You create, Lingohub translates

plugins.name: Grayscale Wireframe Converter
plugins.description: Effortlessly convert your Figma designs into professional grayscale wireframes with the Grayscale Wireframe Converter. Perfect for UX designers and product teams, this plugin transforms selected elements or entire pages into clean, monochromatic wireframes with a single click. It simplifies colors to grayscale for a polished, distraction-free look. Small containers get darker grays for contrast, while larger elements use lighter shades, ensuring readability and hierarchy. Images are replaced with light gray placeholders, and text is optimized for clarity. No network access is required, making it fast and secure. Whether you're iterating on early concepts or presenting low-fidelity prototypes, this plugin streamlines your workflow. Select your design, click "Convert to Wireframe," and watch your vision transform into a stunning grayscale wireframe. Try it now and elevate your process!
plugins.tagline: Transform designs into sleek grayscale wireframes instantly

plugins.name: Iso All
plugins.description:
Iso All seems to be a tool or feature that simplifies the creation of isometric designs. Here's a breakdown of its capabilities based on the provided information:


Key Features:

Automatic Isometric Layer Creation: Eliminates the manual setup process for isometric layers.

Versatile Transformation: Allows you to convert various elements like frames, groups, text, and shapes into isometric perspectives.

Batch Processing: Enables simultaneous transformation of multiple elements, enhancing efficiency.

Benefits:

Time-Saving: Automates a complex process, saving users valuable time.

Flexibility: Offers a wide range of elements that can be converted to isometric.

plugins.name: Theme Engine
plugins.description:
Theme Engine allows you to use Google's Material 3 Dynamic Color to build your own accessible color themes using the HCT (hue, chroma, tone) color space and automate generation of variables and aliases to the variable collection of your choice.


Plugin Github: https://github.com/pbroom/theme-engine


Note:

This is the first release, so any feedback or bug reports are welcome. While I feel it's far from finished, I think it's to the point where it can be of use and help certain users save some time building out accessible color systems. Here are some features in no particular order that I'd like to work on next:

  • Bind variables to styles
  • Variable overwrite control
  • Other color spaces like HSL, HSB, etc.
  • WCAG contrast helper utilities


Credits:

Science of Color Design

How Dynamic Color Works

material-color-utilities

plugins.name: Icon Docu
plugins.description:
Tired of your Figma frames looking like a Picasso painting gone wrong? Dive into the world of organized design with our Figma Fontastic Organizer plugin! 🎨


What's the magic? 🎩

  1. Font Finder: Can't find the "Inter" font? No worries! We'll let you know if it's missing in action.
  2. Frame Fixer: Automatically resizes your frames and sections, giving them the space they deserve.
  3. Component Commander: Rearranges components in a neat and tidy grid. Say goodbye to messy layouts!
  4. Documentation Dynamo: Extracts and displays the name and description of each component and component set. Plus, it keeps a count of how many were created or updated. Knowledge is power!
  5. Auto-Layout Lover: Applies auto-layout to component sets, ensuring they look their best.
  6. Resizer: Adjusts the size of sections to fit their children perfectly. No more guessing games!

How to use?

Just run the plugin and watch as your design transforms from chaotic to charismatic! 🌟


Note: This plugin works best with the "Inter" font in Regular style. Make sure you have it, or we'll give you a heads up!

Join the organized design revolution today! 🌐🔥


Disclaimer: Picasso is a legend, and we're just trying to be funny. No art was harmed in the making of this description. 😅

plugins.name: Multiple font resizer
plugins.description:

This plugin allows you to easily adjust the size of selected text elements.

Instructions for use:

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Run the plugin and choose whether you want to increase or decrease the font size.

By Nicolás Agüero.

plugins.name: Upi Line - SVG Downloader
plugins.description:
Description


This Figma plugin allows users to quickly export their selections as SVG files. The plugin displays a preview of the generated SVG and offers the option to download the file directly.


Features

  1. SVG Preview: Shows a preview of the current selection as an SVG.
  2. SVG Export: Allows downloading the generated SVG with one click.
  3. Multiple Selection Support: You can now select multiple elements and preview them simultaneously.
  4. Download as ZIP Archive: Download all selected SVG elements as a single ZIP archive for convenient access.


Usage

  1. Select an Element: Select an element in Figma to export as SVG.
  2. Preview: A preview of the generated SVG will be displayed in the plugin.
  3. Download: Click the "Download SVG" button to download the SVG file.

plugins.name: Follow the Path
plugins.description:
🧭 FOLLOW THE PATH

A Figma plugin that automatically arranges objects along a vector path with customizable spacing and orientation options.


🎯 FEATURES


🧩 Simple Path Selection

  1. Select any vector path to use as a guide for object placement.


🧱 Multiple Object Support

  1. Arrange one or many objects along your selected path.


🧠 Auto-Detection

  1. The plugin automatically detects both path and objects in your selection.


📏 Flexible Spacing

  1. Auto interval: Distributes objects evenly along the path
  2. Manual interval: Set exact pixel spacing between objects


⚙️ Advanced Controls

  1. Rotate objects to follow the path's direction
  2. Measure from center of objects (optional)
  3. Align objects to start, center, or end of path


🧑‍💻 HOW TO USE


  1. Select a vector path, or select both the path and objects
  2. Configure spacing and alignment preferences
  3. Click “Distribute” to apply


🔬 TECHNICAL DETAILS

  1. Works with any valid vector path
  2. Optimized for performance with large selections
  3. Smart algorithm for precise placement


🚧 BETA NOTICE & KNOWN ISSUES

This is a beta version. Feedback is welcome — future updates may follow based on interest and available time.


⚠️ Known issue:

Native Figma shapes (such as ellipses, stars, and polygons) may incorrectly define the starting point of the path after being edited or used in boolean operations. This can lead to inaccurate object placement.


✅ How to fix:

Copy the shape as SVG and paste it back into the canvas — this will convert it into a clean vector path.

Additionally, you can manually inspect and adjust the nodes if needed.
plugins.tagline: Arrange objects along any vector path with flexible spacing and rotation options.

Note: Requires an OpenAI API Key for alt text generation. You can sign up and get your API key at OpenAI.

plugins.name: Redact
plugins.description:
Redact is your go-to Figma plugin for transforming text into clean, minimalist blocks, perfect for low-fidelity wireframes and abstract design concepts. It takes paragraphs, headlines, or any text, and replaces them with rectangles styled to match the original dimensions and colour. Whether you're prototyping or creating quick concepts, Redact helps you focus on structure over details, letting your ideas shine without the clutter of words. With built-in support for multi-line paragraphs and auto-layout integration, it’s the perfect tool to streamline your design process. Simplify your designs—block by block!


Please note that Redact is designed to run without a user interface. It performs its function immediately when activated. If no selection is made, it notifies the user to select a frame or group.
plugins.tagline: Texts to blocks, the low-fi hack!

plugins.name: Translator
plugins.description:
This is a plugin that creates translation and store templates.

✍️ Blog : How to use Figma translator plugin


🐾 Features

  1. Translate : Translates all strings in the selected frame using Google Translator.
  2. Create Templates : Create android and ios store templates.
  3. Change Fonts : You can change the font of a specific object.


🐾 Translate

  • To be translated, the frame name must contain a language code.
  • It uses Google Translator and has an internal caching function implemented.
  • Some languages have a feature that changes the font when translating.
  • If you use the Auto Size function, the font size is automatically reduced even if the characters become longer after translation, so you can keep the number of lines constant. (For the auto size function to work, the height of the text must not be fixed.)


🐾 Create Templates

  • The frame name is created according to the folder structure supported by fastlane.
  • After exporting the template, you can easily place it in the fastlane folder using the rsync command.
  • Supports Android and iOS store essential device templates.


🐾 Change Fonts

  • Even if a different font is used within one text node, you can only change the font you want.


Enjoy :)
plugins.tagline: Easily translate into multiple languages and create store templates.

plugins.name: Logolens
plugins.description:
Supercharge your design workflow with access to millions of icons and logos, all seamlessly integrated into Figma. Search by industry, color, or category to discover emojis, logos, flags, symbols, and more. Whether you’re creating a brand identity, designing a website, or crafting UI elements, this plugin makes it easy to find and use the perfect visual assets. Browse, search, and drag right into your canvas – all without leaving Figma.


Key Features

  1. Powerful Search: Find the perfect icon or logo by filtering by industry, color, or category.
  2. Diverse Asset Library: Explore millions of high-quality visuals, including brand logos, emojis, symbols, flags, and more.
  3. Figma Integration: Drag and drop assets directly into your Figma designs with ease.
  4. Inspiration on Demand: Discover trends and styles across industries to enhance your creative process.


About LogoLens

LogoLens is a platform dedicated to empowering creatives by making visual exploration simple, intuitive, and inspiring. We are here to help designers bring their ideas to life and explore the world of visual design more deeply.

plugins.name: TypeWise Studio - FInd & Export Font Styles
plugins.description:
TypeWise Studio is here to make typography management in Figma easy and efficient. If you’re tired of digging through layers to find fonts, weights, and sizes, this tool will help you quickly identify and organize all your text styles. Whether you're working solo or in a large team, TypeWise Studio helps you maintain consistency across your designs with minimal effort.


Key Features:


  1. Identify All Font Styles in Your File: Instantly view all fonts, weights, sizes, and and how many times each style is used.
  2. One-Click Style Selection: Select all instances of a font style across your Figma file with a single click. No more hunting down individual layers!
  3. Export a Typography Document: Generate a clean, organized typography document that showcases all your named styles with sample text for easy reference.
  4. Create and Link Figma Styles: With a single click, automatically create Figma styles and link all your text layers to their respective styles for better consistency.
  5. Organize Your Fonts by Usage: Sort and track your fonts based on their frequency of use, making it easier to streamline your typography choices.


Why Use TypeWise Studio? 

Keep your typography workflow efficient, organized, and consistent. Whether you’re building a style guide, preparing a design for handoff, or just cleaning up a messy file, TypeWise Studio makes managing fonts in Figma easier than ever.
plugins.tagline: The Ultimate Typography Manager for Figma

plugins.name: Gradient Mirror

GradientMirror is a Figma plugin designed to simplify the process of reversing gradients within your designs. With GradientMirror, you can quickly invert the order of colors in your gradients, allowing for easy adjustment and experimentation.

plugins.name: External Forms for FigJam
plugins.description:
External forms for FigJam seamlessly integrates with FigJam to offer a simple, yet powerful, way to collect real-time feedback through a remotely accessible form.


This tool generates a public URL link for a custom form where users can create stickies and provide insights, questions, or comments, populating your FigJam boards with stickies.


Key Features:

  • Public URL for Easy Sharing: Generate a public link that you can share with anyone—no account required.
  • Automatically Create Stickies: Users fill out the form, and their stickies appear live on your FigJam board.
  • Zero Setup, Instant Results: Activate FormJam with a single click; no complex setups or API integrations needed.
  • Secure Feedback Loop: Maintain the privacy of your FigJam boards while opening up for targeted public input.


By offering an open channel for feedback, External Forms for FigJam empowers designers, project managers, and team leaders to make more informed decisions, fast-track revisions, and foster a collaborative environment like never before.


External Forms for FigJam is your go-to plugin for enhancing FigJam's collaborative capabilities with external feedback, Q&A, and comments.
plugins.tagline: Elevate Collaboration and Insight Gathering in One Easy Step with External Forms
